headline: How Investors May Respond To Archer-Daniels-Midland (ADM) Earnings Drop, SEC Penalty And Higher Dividend
summary: In early February 2026, Archer-Daniels-Midland Company reported that fourth-quarter 2025 sales fell to US$18,556 million and net income to US$456 million, while also agreeing to a US$40 million SEC civil penalty tied to past accounting and disclosure issues in its Nutrition segment. Despite weaker 2025 earnings and recent regulatory scrutiny, ADM’s board approved a higher quarterly dividend of US$0.52 per share, extending its track record of 53 years of consecutive dividend growth and more...

Despite weaker 2025 earnings and recent regulatory scrutiny, ADM’s board approved a higher quarterly dividend of US$0.52 per share, extending its track record of 53 years of consecutive dividend growth and more...
